medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastric pain after eating.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a one-week history of symptoms that subsided after an hour but had been persistent over the last 24 hours. There were no fevers, chills, or significant changes in bowel habits; however, there was one episode of non-bilious emesis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cholelithiasis, GERD, allergic rhinitis, cough variant asthma.
